text: - Hello and welcome to Community Chats.

I'm Aley Hammer and today,
we're interviewing Nick,
the vice president of sales from UneeQ,

and we're joined by
our very special guest,
Sophie, a digital human.
Nick, thanks so much for joining us today.
So firstly, what is a digital human,

and how has AWS enabled to
create such amazing technology?
First off, Aley, it's great to meet you,

and thank you very much
for having me on the show.

First off, I suppose
the best way to do this
is look at it in three ways.
Digital humans bring AI to life.

Effectively, they are
ultra-realistic 3D characters,
which users can interact with in realtime,
through web or mobile applications.
Now, the value of digital humans
is in their realtime interactive nature.

They need to be able to
connect with customers,

and data systems, and stream
to an end user in realtime,
that also is super high-quality.
Now, AWS allows us to do that
through their cloud environment,
and they allow us to do that to customers
all over the world.
And then, thirdly is scale.

Now, we're the first digital
human platform in the world.
And we've been working really hard
to make technology accessible,
both technically and commercially.
AWS allows us to do this,
so that we can scale up and out

to meet the demand of our
customer base globally.
- How cool is it that UneeQ

is the first digital human
platform in the whole world?
And Sophie, how are customers using you
in their businesses?
- Hi everyone.

So have you ever heard
of a Jack of all trades?

Well, you could say I'm
the Jill of all trades.

Me and my digital human
brothers and sisters

chat to all kinds of people,
for all sorts of reasons.

We help families
understand their finances,
and apply for their first home loan.

We guide shoppers around
retail stores and websites.

I could be the person who
helps you buy your next phone.
Or who finds you a great broadband plan.
And we can even support people
with their physical and mental well-being.

Some customers need
their burning questions
answered right away.
Others just want a friendly chat.

That's where digital humans
like me can really shine.

- Sophie, you sound like
a digital human friend
that I need in my life.
How convenient.

And Nick, I understand you
partnered with Consegna

to build a digital human
on top of Amazon Connect.
This is so cool.

So, can you share a little
bit more about this?

- Yeah, this has been a
really exciting partnership.
And it's just one of the awesome perks
about being on the Amazon Partner Network.
Consegna, you know, that felt fantastic.
They've got an enormous skillset,
and it's not just around Connect,

but it's around the

And together, we've been
able to put together
propositions to connect a whole tech stack

And what's been really good for us,

is we've had a huge
success on top of funnel,

and leveraging organization's

And now, our customers

- That sounds like an
incredible partnership.
And Sophie, back to you.

New-Zealand-accented voice
for Amazon Polly.
This is so exciting.
So Soph, can you give us a quick demo?
- You bet I can.

Thanks to AWS I've now
got a true Kiwi rayo.

I'm actually the first
digital human to have one.
And I think that's a bit sad.
It's actually really important,

because Kiwis are doing fantastic

and I want to help represent--
(speaks foreign language)
Our people and our culture worldwide.

It's important to show who
you are, and I'm Kiwi S.
- Oh my gosh, I love this so much.
And Nick, to round off this interview,
what's next for digital humans?
Do you have any insights about the future
and what everywhere can look forward to?

- Yeah, look, I think the
future's really bright.

You know, we're seeing
a huge role right now
for digital humans in healthcare.
You gotta see it, some customers come out
with some great things.

We're extending the reach of
healthcare providers right now
and delivering some great services.

And digital humans really

within complex services.
And then brand efficacy.

Now just imagine this.

It really, really starts
